subcommands.name: clean
subcommands.description: Delete a job store used by a previous Toil workflow invocation.

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Path to where temporary directory containing all temp files are created, by default generates a fresh tmp dir with 'tempfile.gettempdir()'. (default: /tmp)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)

Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)

subcommands.name: debug-file
subcommands.description: Debug tool for copying files contained in a toil jobStore.
subcommands.usage: Toil [-h] [--logCritical] [--logError] [--logWarning] [--logDebug] [--logInfo] [--logOff] [--logLevel {Critical,Error,Warning,Debug,Info,critical,error,warning,debug,info,CRITICAL,ERROR,WARNING,DEBUG,INFO}] [--logFile LOGFILE] [--rotatingLogging] [--version] [--tempDirRoot TEMPDIRROOT] [--localFilePath LOCALFILEPATH] [--fetch FETCH [FETCH ...]] [--listFilesInJobStore LISTFILESINJOBSTORE] [--fetchEntireJobStore FETCHENTIREJOBSTORE] [--useSymlinks USESYMLINKS] jobStore

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Path to where temporary directory containing all temp files are created, by default generates a fresh tmp dir with 'tempfile.gettempdir()'. (default: /tmp)
Location to which to copy job store files. (default: None)
List of job-store files to be copied locally.Use either explicit names (i.e. 'data.txt'), or specify glob patterns (i.e. '*.txt') (default: None)
Prints a list of the current files in the jobStore. (default: None)
Copy all job store files into a local directory. (default: None)
Creates symlink 'shortcuts' of files in the localFilePath instead of hardlinking or copying, where possible. If this is not possible, it will copy the files (shutil.copyfile()). (default: None)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)
Turn on rotating logging, which prevents log files from getting too big. (default: False)

subcommands.name: destroy-cluster
subcommands.description: Terminates the specified cluster and associated resources.

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Path to where temporary directory containing all temp files are created, by default generates a fresh tmp dir with 'tempfile.gettempdir()'. (default: /tmp)

The provisioner for cluster auto-scaling. This is the '--provisioner' option set for Toil utils like launch-cluster and destroy-cluster, which always require a provisioner, and so this defaults to: aws. Choices: ['aws', 'gce'].

The availability zone of the leader. This parameter can also be set via the 'TOIL_X_ZONE' environment variable, where X is AWS or GCE, or by the ec2_region_name parameter in your .boto file, or derived from the instance metadata if using this utility on an existing EC2 instance. (default: None)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)
Turn on rotating logging, which prevents log files from getting too big. (default: False)

show program's version number and exit

Send SIGKILL to the leader process if local. (default: False)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)
Turn on rotating logging, which prevents log files from getting too big. (default: False)

subcommands.name: launch-cluster
subcommands.description: Launches a toil leader instance with the specified provisioner.
subcommands.usage: Toil [-h] [--provisioner {aws,gce}] [-z ZONE] [--logCritical] [--logError] [--logWarning] [--logDebug] [--logInfo] [--logOff] [--logLevel {Critical,Error,Warning,Debug,Info,critical,error,warning,debug,info,CRITICAL,ERROR,WARNING,DEBUG,INFO}] [--logFile LOGFILE] [--rotatingLogging] [--version] [--tempDirRoot TEMPDIRROOT] [-T {mesos,kubernetes}] --leaderNodeType LEADERNODETYPE [--keyPairName KEYPAIRNAME] [--owner OWNER] [--boto BOTOPATH] [-t NAME=VALUE] [--vpcSubnet VPCSUBNET] [--nodeTypes NODETYPES] [-w WORKERS] [--leaderStorage LEADERSTORAGE] [--nodeStorage NODESTORAGE] [--forceDockerAppliance] [--awsEc2ProfileArn AWSEC2PROFILEARN] [--awsEc2ExtraSecurityGroupId AWSEC2EXTRASECURITYGROUPIDS] clusterName

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Path to where temporary directory containing all temp files are created, by default generates a fresh tmp dir with 'tempfile.gettempdir()'. (default: /tmp)
Cluster scheduler to use. (default: mesos)
Non-preemptable node type to use for the cluster leader. (default: None)
On AWS, the name of the AWS key pair to include on the instance. On Google/GCE, this is the ssh key pair. (default: None)
The owner tag for all instances. If not given, the value inTOIL_OWNER_TAG will be used, or else the value of --keyPairName. (default: None)
The path to the boto credentials directory. This is transferred to all nodes in order to access the AWS jobStore from non-AWS instances. (default: None)

Tags are added to the AWS cluster for this node and all of its children. Tags are of the form: -t key1=value1 --tag key2=value2 Multiple tags are allowed and each tag needs its own flag. By default the cluster is tagged with { "Name": clusterName, "Owner": IAM username }. (default: [])
VPC subnet ID to launch cluster leader in. Uses default subnet if not specified. This subnet needs to have auto assign IPs turned on. (default: None)

Specifies a list of comma-separated node types, each of which is composed of slash-separated instance types, and an optional spot bid set off by a colon, making the node type preemptable. Instance types may appear in multiple node types, and the same node type may appear as both preemptable and non-preemptable. Valid argument specifying two node types: c5.4xlarge/c5a.4xlarge:0.42,t2.large Node types: c5.4xlarge/c5a.4xlarge:0.42 and t2.large Instance types: c5.4xlarge, c5a.4xlarge, and t2.large Semantics: Bid $0.42/hour for either c5.4xlarge or c5a.4xlarge instances, treated interchangeably, while they are available at that price, and buy t2.large instances at full price Must also provide the --workers argument to specify how many workers of each node type to create. (default: None)

Comma-separated list of the ranges of numbers of workers of each node type to launch, such as '0-2,5,1-3'. If a range is given, workers will automatically be launched and terminated by the cluster to auto-scale to the workload. (default: None)
Specify the size (in gigabytes) of the root volume for the leader instance. This is an EBS volume. (default: 50)
Specify the size (in gigabytes) of the root volume for any worker instances created when using the -w flag. This is an EBS volume. (default: 50)
Disables sanity checking the existence of the docker image specified by TOIL_APPLIANCE_SELF, which Toil uses to provision mesos for autoscaling. (default: False)

If provided, the specified ARN is used as the instance profile for EC2 instances.Useful for setting custom IAM profiles. If not specified, a new IAM role is created by default with sufficient access to perform basic cluster operations. (default: None)

Any additional security groups to attach to EC2 instances. Note that a security group with its name equal to the cluster name will always be created, thus ensure that the extra security groups do not have the same name as the cluster name. (default: [])

The provisioner for cluster auto-scaling. This is the '--provisioner' option set for Toil utils like launch-cluster and destroy-cluster, which always require a provisioner, and so this defaults to: aws. Choices: ['aws', 'gce'].

The availability zone of the leader. This parameter can also be set via the 'TOIL_X_ZONE' environment variable, where X is AWS or GCE, or by the ec2_region_name parameter in your .boto file, or derived from the instance metadata if using this utility on an existing EC2 instance. (default: None)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)
Turn on rotating logging, which prevents log files from getting too big. (default: False)

subcommands.name: rsync-cluster
subcommands.description: Rsyncs into the toil appliance container running on the leader of the cluster.

The availability zone of the leader. This parameter can also be set via the 'TOIL_X_ZONE' environment variable, where X is AWS or GCE, or by the ec2_region_name parameter in your .boto file, or derived from the instance metadata if using this utility on an existing EC2 instance. (default: None)

subcommands.name: ssh-cluster

options.description: show this help message and exit

Assign a local port to be used for the Grafana dashboard. (default: 3000)

The provisioner for cluster auto-scaling. This is the '--provisioner' option set for Toil utils like launch-cluster and destroy-cluster, which always require a provisioner, and so this defaults to: aws. Choices: ['aws', 'gce'].

The availability zone of the leader. This parameter can also be set via the 'TOIL_X_ZONE' environment variable, where X is AWS or GCE, or by the ec2_region_name parameter in your .boto file, or derived from the instance metadata if using this utility on an existing EC2 instance. (default: None)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)

subcommands.name: stats
subcommands.description: Reports statistical data about a given Toil workflow.
subcommands.usage: Toil [-h] [--logCritical] [--logError] [--logWarning] [--logDebug] [--logInfo] [--logOff] [--logLevel {Critical,Error,Warning,Debug,Info,critical,error,warning,debug,info,CRITICAL,ERROR,WARNING,DEBUG,INFO}] [--logFile LOGFILE] [--rotatingLogging] [--version] [--tempDirRoot TEMPDIRROOT] [--outputFile OUTPUTFILE] [--raw] [--pretty] [--sortReverse] [--categories CATEGORIES] [--sortCategory {time,clock,wait,memory,alpha,count}] [--sortField {min,med,ave,max,total}] jobStore

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Path to where temporary directory containing all temp files are created, by default generates a fresh tmp dir with 'tempfile.gettempdir()'. (default: /tmp)
File in which to write results. (default: None)
Return raw json data. (default: False)
if not raw, prettify the numbers to be human readable. (default: False)
Reverse sort. (default: False)
Comma separated list of any of the following: ['time', 'clock', 'wait', 'memory']. (default: time,clock,wait,memory)
How to sort job categories. Choices: ['time', 'clock', 'wait', 'memory', 'alpha', 'count']. Default: time. (default: time)
How to sort job fields. Choices: ['min', 'med', 'ave', 'max', 'total']. Default: med. (default: med)
Turn on loglevel Critical. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Error. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Warning. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Debug. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Turn on loglevel Info. Default: INFO. (default: INFO)
Same as --logCRITICAL. (default: INFO)

Set the log level. Default: INFO. Options: ['Critical', 'Error', 'Warning', 'Debug', 'Info', 'critical', 'error', 'warning', 'debug', 'info', 'CRITICAL', 'ERROR', 'WARNING', 'DEBUG', 'INFO']. (default: INFO)
File to log in. (default: None)
Turn on rotating logging, which prevents log files from getting too big. (default: False)

options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit

Return exit value of 1 if toil jobs not all completed. default=False
Do not print overall, aggregate status of workflow. (default: True)
Print dot formatted description of the graph. If using --jobs will restrict to subgraph including only those jobs. default=False
Restrict reporting to the following jobs (allows subsetting of the report). (default: None)
Print info about each job. default=False
Print the log files of jobs (if they exist). default=False
Print children of each job. default=False
